Fields.DialogueText: More and more people keep showing up for the show, Captain! I think I might have even spotted a Belle or two in the audience!
I wouldn't be surprised. There are a couple of ships that look ready to try to climb up on your deck.
I reckon it's a great feeling to know we're doing something positive to keep the morale up!

Fields.MenuText: I enjoy it too! We're making a difference in our own way!
People can finally see my creative genius for what it is.
I'd rather beat morale into my men than deal with this ridiculous charade...

Fields.DialogueText: You're darn tootin', Captain!
Yee haw! That's the spirit, Captain!
Ooo! Shivers down the spine! Your new character is coming around nicely!
Oh! That's right! We need to talk about the chair problem at our shows, Captain.
Jot it down for our to-do list, Arizona, looks like our enemy has arrived as scheduled.
Oh!? Hold my pad and pen, Captain! I'll get these vipers out of our waters in no time!
@BATTLE
Ari and Cap are the best screenwritin' duo on the high seas!
Didja write down these ideas yet?
No...
I gotcher back, Captain! Jottin' this down on the old notepad!
So, with that whole chair incident, the dock owners told us to start providing chairs or hand out fliers with the talent show schedule made in advance, so people know when to bring them.
Shootin' from the hip just ain't gonna cut it anymore with the numbers we bring in for every performance...
If the Morgana were actually co-operative snakes in the grass then maybe we could make a schedule that wouldn't result in so many cancellations... But naw.

Fields.MenuText: Popularity is a double-edged sword when it starts getting out of hand, huh?
I could see if we could arrange a flexible schedule for the shows but duty takes priority over everything else.
Maybe we should limit the show admittance to only being that of the crew and the dock workers on their breaks. The show was originally for our men anyways.

Fields.DialogueText: If folks coming in from the town would put back the crates where they found them then this wouldn't be such a problem...
It's mostly the folks from town making a mess of the dockyard from what the owner has told me himself.
But we have donations for props and food from the local businesses plus all the regular non-navy attendees who will be disappointed if we kick them out now.
*ALARM*
But for now...
@BATTLE
It's a damn shame to see the workers clean and reorganize everything all the time...
Right... They work long enough hours as it is.
Ah. So our problems are from word getting out rather than our timing being inconvenient.
Shucks. A schedule might just make it worse, Captain. We might not have room for everyone.
I'll think of something.
*sighs* This is quite the headache we have for our little show, ain't it?
Not to mention the talents themselves...
What in the blazing jehoshaphat is going on, Captain? You said you were gonna fix the problem, not shoot the dog behind the barn!
Ah. Your captain said you might not understand the turnout being like it is, Miss Arizona. Allow me to explain.
My name is Tellar Starling from Paramount Cinema. The Navy contacted us and asked for a small crew to film your popular talent show so it could be shown to the local cinema in town.
OH MY GOOODD!!!

Fields.MenuText: Pretty exciting, isn't it, Arizona?
WE'RE GOING TO BE ON THE BIG SCREEN, ARIZONA!
It's just local distribution, Arizona. Nothing to be excited about.

Fields.DialogueText: THIS IS BETTER THAN ANY OL' RODEO!
YEE HAW!
My faith in you has paid off greatly, Captain! Even local distribution is incredible for our little group!
@BATTLE
I love you, Captain!! Platonically, of course!
I platonic you too, Arizona.
BIG SCREEN!
BIG SCREEN! BIG SCREEN!
We can have ice water and drink it too, Sheriff!
Anything for you, Deputy.
*ALARM*
It's one thing to do an improv talent show but we're talking the BIG SCREEN, Captain! Our failings will be recorded for all the masses to see!
My grandma is scraping together money to come here to town to watch the production! I can't let her see me telling bad jokes! HELP US!
Y-you ALL need help on yer performance works?!
PLEASE!

Fields.MenuText: Get out of here if all you're going to do is beg for us to write you material.
I agreed to the 'writing circle' as a way to foster ideas and give feedback but we are not going to write your material for you.
Not on your life.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Boys... We're grasping tumbleweeds on our end as well...
We'll figure something out as well, Captain! Please don't laugh if it's bad!
I won't now. Get to writing! Shake a leg!
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
If you want critic then we'll help you out but we have our own time set to fill.
Sorry, Fellas. Our wagon is as loaded as it can be...
Not on your dear grandma's savings either!
*ALARM*
Aw-shucks, Captain! I can't think of anything in this heat. Figuratively and literally!
Nothing feels solid on paper as of late!
What haven't we written about yet?

Fields.MenuText: An exotic romance short?
An exotic action short?
An exotic murder mystery short?

Fields.DialogueText: You just want to take a vacation, Captain!
W-what?! I would never impl-!
Ain't there a base out there in Hawaii? Maybe we could dock over there for a while to see if inspiration comes to us!
Oh? You mean Pearl Harbor?
Oh?! It's named after a pearl?! So lovely!
Enemy spotted, Captain!
We'll head over there when I can make the arrangements, Arizona. For now, let's focus!
Roger, Captain!
@BATTLE
Oahu! Honolulu! Actual active volcanoes! A trip of a lifetime!
I'm shaking in my boots just thinking about it all, Captain!
It's gonna be nothing like the Californian ports! A grand paradise!

Fields.MenuText: A naval base is the same no matter where it is, Arizona.
Want me to fetch a tour guide after we dock then have a tour cruise around the islands?
Did you know that battleships have a name for the section in the harbor?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't poison the water hole I'm drinking from, Captain! I've never been out this far into the Pacific before!
I'd pony up for that, Captain! It would be good to learn of our new home since the Morganas are likely beating on the islands as well.
Let a gal guess this one! It's something stale and in English like "Battleship Row," right?
Look at who decided to ruin our stress-free trip to Hawaii, Arizona.
All I see are Morganas about to become driftwood, Captain!
@BATTLE
Sink your dreams before you get disappointed, Arizona. It's for the better.
Old boots have more shine to them than you right now, Captain.
WHO'S AN OLD BOOT?
I'll make sure the paperwork gets filled then.
The natives got to name it, right?
Ah... On second thought, let's drop the topic.
Battleship Row, huh?
You don't look thrilled.
Pff. Might as well call me "Super-Dreadnought Battleship Number 39" while we're corralled at this barn...

Fields.MenuText: "Arizona" is much cuter, to be completely honest.
"Arizona" is a lot easier to say quickly than the alternative.
I get your beef with the name, Arizona. The name serves its purpose and function though.

Fields.DialogueText: Aw shucks, Captain!  I like my name a lot too!
Ain't that the gospel truth, Captain. I like my name, anyways! There's a lot more fire in the name Arizona!
'No destroyers allowed'! Aren't I right?
Anyways, let's get walking the docks and see what we can see together, All right?
Lead the way, Sheriff!
@BATTLE
What, is this some exclusive club now?
Heh heh!
*ALARM*
This place is so lovely, Captain. I feel a calm in my wild spirit just looking at it all.
Sure, we all have our troubles in life and the Morganas are pretty much flies that can cause real trouble when not kept under watch but...
A gal can really raise her cannons here and let loose.

Fields.MenuText: One of those sentences is not like the other.
Should I be worried now?
I think you're dehydrated.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh heh! That ain't what I meant at all, Captain! I'll try saying it better so you don't hogtie me to the mast all the way home!
Basically... It's like what the folks in Japan call 'zen', finding your inner peace. I didn't mean 'letting loose' like firing my guns but more similar to letting off anxiety.
Oh good. I was a little nervous for a second there.
Tarnation, Captain! I ain't gonna go loony on ya anytime soon!
I reckon this place might just be what I need to really focus on our next big hit.
I'm glad it was worth the effort to come out here.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Okay, just take it from the top.
Shouting "fire?"
Yeah.
Deal.
Fire! Fire! Fire!
Send them on an express trip right to the Devil himself!

Fields.MenuText: All aircraft are launched, Admiral! They'll never see it coming!
We're giving them all we got, Boss!
God save the Queen!

Fields.DialogueText: I fear, that if we do not finish them in one fell swoop, we will awaken the giant from its slumber...
What do I PAY you for if you can't get the cops off our tails?
W-what?! That's not in the script, Captain!
*ALARM*
Aw, man. The critics are here.
@BATTLE
We shall strike the volcano monster sure and true, Admiral!
Wait. I wrote something about a volcano monster in the script...?
Weren't we writing about a giant monster story?
Oh! You're right! I don't know why I forgot about that detail in the first place!
Put more holes in them, Boys!
GOTCHA, BOSS!
Ow! Watch who you're elbowing, Numbskull!
Pedal to the metal! We didn't rob a bank just to go back to the slammer!
Oh. Well. I thought it might be fun to improvise a line or two...
We agreed that we won't be doing off the script performances for this filming, Captain. Don't be a rotten rulebreaker now!
I'm sorry. Let's start back from the top then.
(writing) I felt at rest above the sea. Above the expanse that stretched out as far as the eye can see.
With anchors logged firmly in the sands down below, I feel my cheeks brightening and all aglow.
Urgh! What in tarnation am I even writing?! Now's not the time for sappy poems for the fire!

Fields.MenuText: You still have writer's block, Arizona?
Don't crumble your poems like that, Arizona. You'll regret it later when you smudge the ink over a sentence you loved.
War means rationing your supplies, Missy.

Fields.DialogueText: Is it that plum obvious, Captain...?
A-ah...! This is just a warm up you know, Captain! Trying to get in the mood!
A-ah! Captain! I didn't see ya standing there!
The lighting isn't the best for your eyes. Let's head inside the ship where you can actually see your notepad then?
Certainly!
@BATTLE
Darn tootin'...
*ALARM*
See any vipers yet?!
Not yet, Ma'am! You'll be the first one we let know!
Roger that, Fellas!
Oh! Captain! Mind if I join you for a walk?

Fields.MenuText: I'm a bit busy right now, Arizona.
Sure thing.
Maybe never, Arizona.

Fields.DialogueText: Aw shucks, let me help ya out then! I ain't your Deputy to just be sitting around ya know?
Good! I was gettin' rather bored standing around with no action goin' on!
I'm gonna need a lot of aloe vera for that burn, Captain...
Morgana ahoy, Miss Arizona!!
*gasps*
Get on out there and make me proud, Deputy!
Roger, Captain!
@BATTLE
Let me do a walk of the artillery teams to make sure they ready anyways!
Your charming personality will not allow you to slip away from the law's hands once again, Mr. Burnoff!
The only thing I find credible there is your description of my personality.
No more jokes! You murdered Mrs. Claribella out of rage when you thought she was kissing the pool boy, Simon Filips!

Fields.MenuText: This is an outrage! I'll not have my name being smeared all over the courtroom and have to also bear the weight of my dearly departed wife's death at the hands of that pool boy!
Simon Filips was and always WILL BE a DOG! Hounding over my wife like a horny street mutt!
What are you TALKING about?! Simon Filips is my golden retriever!! He's certainly a 'pool boy' but not like THAT!

Fields.DialogueText: Like how you smeared her face all over the floor when you dragged her body back inside?!
You should have fired him then if you suspected he was putting in unaccounted 'overtime', Mr. Burnoff!
O-oh! Y-you don't say...?!
@BATTLE
You have no proof!! I'll see you stripped of your badge and thrown into the trash where your kind belongs!
Ooo! Great response! We might need to tweak the line a bit though.
He was cheap and knew how to give a good back rub! Who fires someone like that?!
Pffft! Captain! Hah hah hah!
First you insult my wife and NOW MY DOG?! THE NERVE OF YOU AND YOUR LAWYER-TYPES!
Assistant! Why didn't you tell me the 'pool boy' was actually a dog?!
B-because you're in charge of the case and should have already read the file thoroughly?!
Excellent job, Everyone! We're getting closer to something great!
*ALARM*
Aw shucks! You fellas are way too kind to help a gal out with handing out water!
You're an inspiration to us all, Ma'am!
Nawwww!

Fields.MenuText: Are you men harassing Arizona with your compliments again?
Are the volunteers out in force today, Arizona?
Stop trying to butter her up, men! Have some decency!

Fields.DialogueText: Tarnation, Captain! You're helping me carry trays of glasses as well!
Shucks, Captain! They came out of the woodworks the moment I started filling up glasses!
Captain! I'm sure these fellas only have the purest of intentions!
@BATTLE
Heh. Can't be outdone by the rookies now can I?
Guess they appreciate all you do for them.
I sure hope so!
You sure about that?
Heh heh!
*ALARM*
It's a shame we'll have to head back soon, Captain. I reckon I rather like it here - even with the Morgana infestation!
Quite the compliment.
Not that I don't like the Californian ports, t'say!
I like it here as well. Maybe you should think about building a house here when the war is over.
A... A house?!
I don't think the island is big enough to allow ranches, though.
Ranches?!
Or maybe you would like a beach house on the sea?
It's not a good idea to tease a gal like that, Captain! Especially when she's got guns! Big impressive guns.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Paper. Pencils. Gallons of coffee. I think we're ready.
Okay. Our previous ideas weren't the figurative bee's knees, so...
Any ideas?

Fields.MenuText: What about a horror short?
How about another romance short?
You're brilliant at writing comedies, Arizona. Why not feature one of your finest?

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmm... Maybe monsters from outer space, Captain?
Maybe... How bout a monster romance story?!
Well, I do have a comedy about desert monster cowboys entering a bar!
*ALARM*
Oh, come on!
@BATTLE
What's with you and monsters these days, Arizona?
Heh heh!
Do we even have the budget to make decent costumes this time...?
... Pocket book is rather empty this month from all the food we bought on the island...
... That's gonna be an unusual punchline for sure...
Heh heh!
I'm waaaaalkin' in the rain! Yee haw! I'm waaaaaalkin' in the rain!
Um, Ma'am? I don't mean to be a bother but you're not allowed to sing when it isn't practice hours with your tutor...
Tarnation! It's a blessing from the heavens above to have a lovely spell of light rain in the desert, Sailor!
It's a doggone sin to not sing praises for the gift, right, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Please don't torture the men while they're at work, Arizona. There's a reason why we wait til we're at port before we let you have singing lessons.
Maybe when you're in your own cabin. You're the polar opposite of a siren, Arizona.
Eh. She's not singing anything we know so why not let her hum a tune or two?

Fields.DialogueText: T-that's harsher than ten licks of the whip, C-Captain!
C-Can I apply for a transfer to a new fleet? *sniffs*
AH! You're a downright charmer, Captain!
Never mind the sounds on the wind! We got company, Captain!
PERFECT! ARIZONA, YOU HAVE YOUR AUDIENCE!
It's SHOWTIME!
@BATTLE
We just did that.
Darn...!
Everyone got their ear plugs? I got a spare to share!
Let's see here... I am the bane of my gun? No no no, too cotton-pickin' cheesy.
It's suppose to be comedy, Ari, a comedy!
*Sighs* This place is too darn pretty to give me a mood for laughs... OH! Captain! PERFECT! Get on over here for a second!

Fields.MenuText: Oh god what is she up to.
(Turn around and run)
What's going on?

Fields.DialogueText: Captain! Let's do some improv! My brain needs a joggin'!
Oh, good. I was worried for a second there...
You'll be the shop owner and I'll be a no-good brat out to swindle from your candy buckets!
... It is gonna be something weird after all.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
This ain't good. We got two distress calls; one from the destroyer squadron and the other from the carrier divisions that were out practicing.
The aircraft carriers are under attack by enemy aircraft while the destroyers are getting fired on by heavy cruisers and battleships!
... This ain't good, Captain. I'm only fast enough to reach one of the groups.
The ships anchored at the harbor that sortied with us should be able to assist the group we don't pick so it's just preference at this point, right?
That's what it sounds like, Captain.
I'm ready to pony up for any challenge you pick, Captain. Vultures don't rattle my boots anymore.

Fields.MenuText: Take no risks! We ride to save the destroyers!
We are no cowards for flying rats in the sky! READY UP THE ARTILLERY GUNS!

Fields.DialogueText: Lasso and cannons are ready to go, Sheriff!
We'll hogtie their air squadrons, Sheriff! READY UP!
I like the enthusiasm.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
This should be it. The last dregs of the Morgana group.
I know, I know. I should be happy - and I am!
But I'm gonna miss these waters.
Well, let's make sure they're safe first.
Point.
@BATTLE
Taking it all in one last time before we leave, Arizona?
Yeah... I know we're just leaving temporarily but this cowgirl was getting used to docking at Battleship Row.
It feels like I belong here. The sun sets perfectly from this place.

Fields.MenuText: We'll be all right, Arizona.
We'll be coming back here anyways with the Morgana activity being the way it is here.
Want to walk the docks once last time before we leave?

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain. For bringing us all here.
I know, Captain. Thank you for being a good friend.
You're darn tootin' I am! Let's go!
Don't mention it.
You... you...
Why, Miss Taggart, I really don't see what the problem is. The sun is shining, and the breeze should dry out those old rags in no time.
That's not laundry, that's my mother you hung out on the clothesline!

Fields.MenuText: Really? She WAS rather starchy...
I'm so sorry! She was just sitting next to the laundry pil-
Wow. Your mother could double as a kite for how light she is out there.

Fields.DialogueText: You hung up my mother as a joke?! TO MAKE A PUN NO LESS?!
She was WASHING the laundry, you Nincompoop!
I can't believe you! Get her down before someone calls the police for neglect!
*loud laughter from the audience*
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I reckon we're screwed if we can't come up with something decent for the filming, Captain!
Calm down. There's still time to sort things out.
Not that much! The public is counting on us to give them a good show!

Fields.MenuText: Are none of the ideas good?
The trip didn't help?
Why are we so bad at this?

Fields.DialogueText: Tarnation! I thought the change of scenery would help refresh the brain but nothin' feels right!
Everything feels forced and unnatural! Like wearing fake leather boots!
I think the anxiety is just getting to you, Arizona. We'll do fine like always.
*sighs* But I don't want to let everyone down if we don't bring out our best hats for this...
Come on. Let's go run on the deck and work off the stress, Arizona.
Right behind you, Sheriff...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
*ALARM*
Aw, son of a...
Better to get this over with now than later.
*sigh*
@BATTLE
Well, grease me up and crack an egg on me, they actually came!
We did hire them, Arizona...
Oh! There you two are! Remember me? I'm Mr. Starling from Paramount?
I remember. Welcome to our little slice of home.
'Little' is right but we've worked with much smaller sets before! I assume you are all ready for this?

Fields.MenuText: Nope.
Yep, I'm always ready!

Fields.DialogueText: Well, we're only doing filming for a few days so you better be ready to go when it's your turn!
Glad to hear it. We'll be calling you two over when your skit is up.
Roger that, Mr. Starling!
That's our captain! Ready for anything!
The party crashers sure know when to show up!
Don't get too cocky, Arizona. We all need to get back safe and sound, like always.
The round up is always filled with danger but only the best cowboys go out to the frontlines to lasso up the biggest of the livestock!
Guns are loaded and ready for highnoon! DRAW!
@BATTLE
I could use a good brawl or two to get this stress off my mind!
All right, you two, give it your best! Lights, Camera, Action!
(a few minutes later)
(Arizona grasps her sword tightly as the Captain, dressed as a black knight, approaches for the death blow.)
This day...! I will not fall to you or your archers...! You have no honor n-nor a spine of a knight even though you call yourself one!
Your pride will be your undoing. To expect nothing but overwhelming force from your enemy, even when they agree to a 'duel' is laughably childish.
(The captain raises the blade above Arizona and readies to behead her.)
Peridot... I...
(The blade comes down, hitting the ground behind Arizona as she falls with the strike.)
Aaaaand CUT!
@BATTLE
There is no 'honor' but 'glory' for those who win under any means necessary.
*ALARM*
Perfect timing.
I saw the screening of the film in the theatre with my mom and she cried when she saw your skit, Miss Arizona!
How can that be the end?! I WON'T ACCEPT IT!!
Heh heh! Shucks! I'm glad that everyone was so moved by the performance. Even with the captain dolled up in cardboard armor.

Fields.MenuText: How rude!
I didn't want to wear it either!
*grumble*

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, don't take it like that. Not everybody could've pulled it off the way you did!
We all have to suffer for our art, Captain.
Aw, you know you loved it.
Ah, well. At least I didn't lose my day job.
Like you ain't proud of our baby.
A toast to our success?
A toast to our success!
*Ching*
Yet.
